trans-unit.source: Provides a collection of application-scoped objects for the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationState.StaticObjects"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> class.
Copies members of an <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> into an array.
The array to copy the <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> into.
The member of the collection where copying starts.
Gets the number of objects in the collection.
The number of objects in the collection.

Creates an <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> object from a binary file that was written by using the <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Serialize(System.IO.BinaryWriter)"></xref> method.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Deserialize%2A> method is used to read the contents of a <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> object that is stored in a storage location that is created by the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Serialize%2A> method.
To serialize an <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection>, use the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Serialize%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.IO.BinaryReader"></xref> used to read the serialized collection from a stream or encoded string.

An <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> populated with the contents from a binary file written using the <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Serialize(System.IO.BinaryWriter)"></xref> method.
Returns a dictionary enumerator used for iterating through the key-and-value pairs contained in the collection.
The enumerator for the collection.
Returns the object with the specified name from the collection.
This property is an alternative to the `this` accessor.
The case-insensitive name of the object to return.
An object from the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
Always returns `true`.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is synchronized (that is, thread-safe).
In this implementation, this property always returns `false`.
Gets the object with the specified name from the collection.
The case-insensitive name of the object to get.
An object from the collection.
Gets a Boolean value indicating whether the collection has been accessed before.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref> has never been accessed; otherwise, `false`.
Writes the contents of the collection to a <xref href="System.IO.BinaryWriter"></xref> object.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Serialize%2A> method to write the contents of a <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> object to a <xref:System.IO.BinaryWriter> object.
To retrieve a serialized <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> object, use the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.Deserialize%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.IO.BinaryWriter"></xref> used to write the serialized collection to a stream or encoded string.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Program code should generally perform synchronized operations on the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection.SyncRoot%2A> of a collection, not directly on the collection itself.
This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects.
Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection object.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> itself.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection"></xref>.
